title: Exciting Cars to Watch in 2024
content:
BYD Seal Performance
BYD introduces the sleek Seal sedan to its expanding lineup. Does this stylish newcomer have what it takes to challenge the established players?

Tesla Model 3 RWD
After much anticipation, Tesla has revamped its Model 3, enhancing its refinement and quality. How does this veteran car, now in its seventh year, stack up in 2024?

Audi R8
Audi ventures into new terrain with its alloy R8, positioning itself against the likes of Porsche and Lamborghini. How does the original V8 model fare after 17 years?

Hyundai Kona
Hyundai's original Kona set a high standard to follow. The new iteration is larger, better equipped, and offers additional variants. But is it an improvement overall?

Honda CR-V RS vs Nissan X-Trail e-Power Ti-L
Medium-sized SUVs may not necessarily excite, but their all-around competence is hard to overlook. For those seeking a hybrid without the wait for a RAV4, these two contenders are worth considering.

Lexus RZ 450e Dynamic
Lexus, known for its range of hybrids, is now embracing full electric vehicles. Joining the UX EV is the new RZ—a larger and upscale electric offering.

Skoda Enyaq 80 Coupe Sportline Max
The Enyaq takes on a sportier persona in its coupe form. Does the enhanced look compromise Skoda's renowned practicality?

Lexus UX 300e
Lexus' first electric vehicle, based on an ICE platform, initially fell short in range and space. Discover how the latest improvements address these concerns.

Ineos Grenadier
When the Defender shifted away from its basic off-road roots, Ineos stepped in with the Grenadier—a modern successor true to its off-road heritage.

MG MG4 64 Essence
This electric wonder left a positive impression upon first drive. Now, how does it hold up over the long haul?

Honda ZR-V Turbo
Honda's versatile SUV is now available in both hybrid and non-hybrid versions. Explore the non-hybrid iteration reviewed over the holiday season.

Hyundai Santa Fe 2.2 Calligraphy
One last evaluation of the diesel-powered Santa Fe—does it maintain its relevance in today's market?

BMW R 1250 R
While most larger motorcycles feature inline fours or v-twin engines, BMW distinguishes itself with its horizontally opposed boxer twins as seen in the latest R 1250 R.

Harley-Davidson Nightster
The Nightster joins Harley's modern Sportster lineup with a powerful 975cc V-twin engine. Could it potentially serve as an alternative to the Sportster 1250?
section: We’re cracking nicely into 2024 with a hot list of cars this August – have a look at what we’re featuring this month!
